thread.title: Inactive Obama campaign owes nearly $2 million in legal fees
thread.title_full: Inactive Obama campaign owes nearly $2 million in legal fees - POLITICO

author: Glenn Thrush
title: Inactive Obama campaign owes nearly $2 million in legal fees
text:
Obama for America, President Barack Obama's 2012 reelection campaign committee, raised and spent more than $200,000 in the third quarter, with nearly $30,000 going toward the $1.9 million it still owes its lawyers. The dormant campaign brought in more than $290,000 in list rentals from July through September, and spent just more than $212,000 — over 14 percent of which went to Washington law firm Perkins Coie.
The legal fees owed to Perkins Coie are a high amount for a campaign that's no longer active.
But the committee also owes AKPD Message and Media — the consulting firm founded by chief Obama strategist David Axelrod — more than $25,000, on top of $35,000 owed directly to Axelrod Strategies.
That, in turn, is in addition to $5,000 the campaign paid AKPD in the third quarter. Axelrod, who now directs the University of Chicago's Institute of Politics, is a frequent television commentator, and he has often been critical of Hillary Clinton's campaign.
Obama defends plan to keep troops in Afghanistan By Nick Gass
The Thursday morning filing also showed that the group valued its email list at roughly $1.9 million when it was transferred to the Democratic National Committee this summer.
